abstract: Chamath Palihapitiya, the founder of the Social+Capital Partnership, says he has no interest in adhering to the traditional venture capital model.
snippet: Chamath Palihapitiya, the founder of the Social+Capital Partnership, says he has no interest in adhering to the traditional venture capital model.
lead_paragraph: Four years ago, Chamath Palihapitiya, seemed poised for a long career on Sand Hill Road, the famed strip in Menlo Park, Calif., lined with Silicon Valley's most powerful venture capital firms. As a principal for the Mayfield Fund, one of the country's oldest venture firms, he wore the industry's unofficial uniform faithfully everyday, a buttoned-down shirt and pressed pants.

headline.main: In Flip-Flops and Jeans, An Unconventional Venture Capitalist
